basic_info.description: As a seasoned software engineer with over 3 years of hands-on experience, I excel in both server-side and client-side development. My technical expertise spans across a variety of technologies including React/ React Native, TypeScript, Java, Spring Boot, Flowable, CSS,GraphQL, FastAPI, Terraform, and AWS. I have a Master's in Computer Science from Indiana University Bloomington and a Bachelor's in Information Technology from Anna University. My professional journey includes significant contributions to infrastructure optimization, database operations, and the implementation of RESTful microservices. I am adept at leveraging tools like Spring Boot, Redux, and Next.js to enhance application performance and user experience. Certified in AWS and Azure, I thrive in Agile environments and have a proven track record of driving project success.

education.course_work: Software Engineering, Data Mining, Engineering Cloud Computing, Database Design, Applied Machine Learning
Data Structures and Algorithms, Pattern Recognition, Introduction to IT, Intro. to Soft Computing

projects.title: Blog Hosting Platform on AWS with Automated Deployment
projects.description: Developed a multi-user blog hosting platform on AWS, leveraging Terraform and Ansible for automated provisioning and deployment, with CI/CD pipelines on Jenkins and scalable traffic management.

projects.title: Pneumonia Detection System
projects.description: Designed and deployed a COVID-19 and pneumonia detection website on AWS, with ReactJS for Frontend, Sageamaker to train the model, AWS S3 to host and store the user x-ray, AWS Lambda to trigger AWS Sagemaker to classify the X-ray.

projects.title: Stock Recommendation Website
projects.description: Built a website using Angular for user interaction, incorporating NgRx for state management and Node.js for API development to enable seamless frontend and backend communication, and hosted the application on Firebase.

projects.title: Automated Cloud Infrastructure Development for Research Plaforms
projects.description: Designed and deployed AWS infrastructure using Terraform and Ansible, automating the setup of scalable and secure environments for research tools, reducing provisioning time by 60%.

projects.title: Hotel Monitoring System
projects.description: Engineered a comprehensive hotel booking and recommendation Website for customers and hotel owners using ReactJs technologies at client, Java Spring Boot at server side and MYSQL, achieving operational efficiency of 25%.

experience.title: Software Engineer
mainTech: Java, Spring Boot, AWS, AngularJS, PorstgreSQL
experience.description: At Hoosier Community Network, I lead a team to develop, deploy and maintain a website. I used AngularJs and TypeScript for the frontend and Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, Hiberante for the backend and deployed the website on AWS using tools like Docker, Git, ECR, ECS, AWS IAM, Virtual Network and maintained the website using AWS ClouWatch, CloudTrail and other tools whenever required

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: At Indiana University, I improved SQL query performance, integrated server-side solutions with Spring Boot, and enhanced client-side functionality with React.js. I also managed infrastructure optimizations, leveraged AWS services for scaling, and adhered to Agile methodologies to boost productivity. My technical expertise includes Java, Spring Framework, React, AWS, and various databases, with a focus on performance optimization and scalable architecture.

experience.title: Software Engineer
mainTech: React.js, Redux, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud (Eureka, Api Gateway)
experience.description: I worked as a Software Engineer where I focused on enhancing data accessibility and integrating it with Angular to create responsive user interfaces, which improved overall performance by 15%. I was responsible for maintaining RESTful APIs using Java and Spring Boot, and my efforts helped reduce server response times by 20%. I also implemented DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins and Docker for version control, which streamlined our development process. My work with Hibernate, JDBC, and Flowable was crucial in ensuring efficient data operations within our microservices architecture. Additionally, I configured Swagger in Spring MVC and developed APIs using AWS Lambda to facilitate seamless data retrieval from SQL databases.

experience.title: Software Engineer
mainTech: Next.js, Spring Boot, Spring Security, JWT, Spring AOP
experience.description: I contributed as a Software Engineer, where I developed key modules of Sling TV, specifically the Guide and Home modules, using React.js. This work led to a 25% increase in user engagement by optimizing content delivery and improving the user interface. I also played a key role in integrating our frontend and backend systems with AWS-based media streaming microservices, using MongoDB for data storage and React for content rendering. Furthermore, I worked extensively with REST APIs and microservices using Spring, and I utilized Kubernetes for scalable deployments. My responsibilities also included writing Oracle SQL queries and PL/SQL procedures to manage data within our databases, and I implemented the Spring framework to support dependency injection and data access patterns.

publications.title: Design and Implementation of Efficient Stochastic Number Generator
publications.author: Sanjith Reddy P V, Sai Sanath Potnuru, Sonali Agrawal
publications.publisher: International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Communication Technologies (ICECCT 2021)
publications.abstract: Stochastic Computing (SC) is a logical computational technique that performs operations on random bit streams. These random bit streams are generated using stochastic number generators (SNG). In the circuits using stochastic computing, SNGs consume most of the physical area and power. This paper proposes power and speed efficient 4-bit and 8-bit SNGs by using modified Non-linear Feedback Shift Register (NLFSR) as Random Number Source (RNS) and by applying the concept of sharing of an RNS with many SNGs. An n bit NLFSR can generate all 2 n random sequences. The 4-bit and 8-bit NLFSRs, designed using the bipartite technique, are proposed to reduce the delay and power consumed by the SNG. In this paper, proposed 4-bit and 8-bit SNGs are designed and implemented using Xilinx ISE tool and their performance concerning area, power, and delay, are evaluated with Cadence Genus synthesis solution in 45nm technology. The performance of proposed SNGs is compared with the existing SNGs and this comparison shows that the proposed SNGs are more efficient in terms of power and speed. It is also observed that as the number of bits increases, the reduction in power consumption and delay also increases for the proposed design with respect to the existing design.
publications.cite: S. R. P. V, S. Sanath Potnuru, T. S. Venkatesh and S. Agrawal, "Design and Implementation of Efficient Stochastic Number Generator," 2021 Fourth International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Communication Technologies (ICECCT), Erode, India, 2021, pp. 1-7, doi: 10.1109/ICECCT52121.2021.9616758.
